column4: hi all i'm new to the whole linux thing and i was wondering.. i have a 64 bit computer does it really make a difference between 32 bit and 64 bit ubuntu?
Yes, if you have over 4GB of RAM and don't wish to use a PAE-enabled kernel.
i'm not really too sure what that means i know when i ran 64 bit with windows it made a 32 bit folder (i'm not really sure why) but i'm planning on taking windows off completely
Well, as I say, it only ever has a point if you run on a system with more than 4 gigs of RAM
